page.title: 11The River Severn
page.content: Our area is dominated by the river.It exerts its powerful and pervasive presence even though it is not always easily seen as it flows between muddy banks which are flanked by levees:man-made almost continuous mounds set a few metres back from the edges of the river,parallel to them, intended to prevent flooding of the low-lying land and,incidentally, giving the walker a good raised path from which to observe its life.The river is tidal here and its brown-grey water swirls restlessly up and down stream with occasional debris such as a tree-trunk or fuel-drum.In its waters swim eels and salmon,both important to the people of the area.Its propensity for flooding dictates the use of the land round it:low-intensity farming,houses and barns carefully sited,summer crops.
